ca.mcgill.ecse211.mountev3rest.navigation

Class Navigation

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.mountev3rest.navigation.Navigation
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Navigation
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Provides an interface to move the robot to an arbitrary point on the grid.

    The Navigation enables the robot to go to arbitrary locations on the grid by computing the required distance and angle to reach it from the odometer's readings. Additionally, the class runs on its own thread to enable the caller to change direction at any point if an event occurs.

    Additionally, the Navigation class can optionally provide trajectory correction while traveling by polling odometer angle reading and recomputing the path of travel.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Navigation

        public Navigation(EV3LargeRegulatedMotor leftMotor,
                  EV3LargeRegulatedMotor rightMotor,
                  boolean trajectoryCorrection,
                  double WHEEL_RADIUS,
                  double TRACK,
                  double MOTOR_OFFSET,
                  double SENSOR_OFFSET)
           throws OdometerException,
                  PollerException
        Creates a navigator that will operate using the specified track and wheel radius values.
        Parameters:
        leftMotor - Left motor of the robot.
        rightMotor - Right motor of the robot.
        trajectoryCorrection - Enables trajectory correction using two light sensors.
        WHEEL_RADIUS - Wheel radius of the robot't wheels measured in centimeters.
        TRACK - Measurement of the robot's track in centimeter.
        MOTOR_OFFSET - Ration between the speeds of the left and right motors. Used to correct error in navigation.
        SENSOR_OFFSET - Vertical distance between the wheel base and the light sensors in centimeters.
        Throws:
        OdometerException - If the singleton Odometer class has not been instantiated.
        PollerException - If the LightPoller has not been instantiated.

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        Runs the state machine main logic. This involves setting the direction of the robot to a new target if required and optionally applying trajectory correction.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • travelTo

        public void travelTo(double x,
                     double y)
        Sets current target and indicates the state machine to retrace the trajectory.
        Parameters:
        x - New target X position.
        y - New target Y position.

      • travelToX

        public void travelToX(double x)
        Sets current target and indicates the state machine to retrace the trajectory. This method will only move the robot in the ±X direction.
        Parameters:
        x - New target X position.

      • travelToY

        public void travelToY(double y)
        Sets current target and indicates the state machine to retrace the trajectory. This method will only move the robot in the ±Y direction.
        Parameters:
        y - New target Y position.

      • turnTo

        public void turnTo(double theta)
        Turns to an absolute angle with respect to the grid ensuring minimal rotation. This method constantly polls the gyro sensor angle reading reading to ensure high accuracy. Positive angles are defined as counter-clockwise rotation and vice-versa.
        Parameters:
        theta - Desired angle of rotation.

      • turnToRelative

        public void turnToRelative(double theta)
        Turns to an relative angle with respect to the current position ensuring minimal rotation. Positive angles are defined as counter-clockwise rotation and vice-versa.
        Parameters:
        theta - Desired angle of rotation.

      • advanceDist

        public void advanceDist(double dist)
        Makes the robot move forward a determined distance and waits until the distance has been traveled.
        Parameters:
        dist - Distance to travel forward in centimeters.

      • isNavigating

        public boolean isNavigating()
        Indicates whether the robot is still navigating.
        Returns:
        Boolean values indicating if the robot is moving.

      • waitNavigation

        public void waitNavigation()

      • computeDistance

        public double computeDistance(double x,
                              double y)
        Computes the distance from the current robot's position to a particular target location in centimeters.
        Parameters:
        x - Target X coordinate.
        y - Target Y coordinate.
        Returns:
        The distance between the robot and the target coordinates in centimeters.

      • estimateCurrentLine

        public int estimateCurrentLine()
        Estimates the closest line to the robot according to the odometer's readings and the current heading.
        Returns:
        An integer indicating the closest line to the robot on the grid according with respect to the robot's current heading.

      • adjustTrajectory

        public void adjustTrajectory(int laggingSide)
        Adjusts the trajectory of the robot by stopping the leading side and waiting until the lagging side sees a line. In case the lagging side takes too long to see a line, the rotation caused by stopping one of the wheels is reversed and the method returns.
        Parameters:
        laggingSide - Integer denoting which side is lagging. The encoding is 0 for left and 1 for right.

      • enableCorrection

        public void enableCorrection()
        Enables trajectory correction upon line detections.

      • disableCorrection

        public void disableCorrection()
        Disables trajectory corrections upon line detections.

      • isCorrectionEnabled

        public boolean isCorrectionEnabled()
        Communicates external parts of the code whether trajectory correction is currently enabled.
        Returns:
        True is trajectory correction is currently enabled, and False otherwise.

      • convertDistance

        public static int convertDistance(double radius,
                                  double distance)
        Converts a value distance to the equivalent degrees of rotation in the wheels. Wheel radius and distance should be in the same units.
        Parameters:
        radius - Wheel radius to use for conversion.
        distance - Distance to convert.
        Returns:
        Required angle of rotation for the motors in degrees.

      • convertAngle

        public static int convertAngle(double radius,
                               double width,
                               double angle)
        Computes the required distance travel of each wheel assuming opposite directions to achieve a certain degree of rotation.
        Parameters:
        radius - Wheel radius.
        width - Width of the robot.
        angle - Desired angle of rotation.
        Returns:
        Required angle of rotation in degrees on each wheel.
